question:
A friend has agreed to look after your house and pet while you are on holiday. Write a letter to your friend.

In your letter

give contact details for when you are away
give instructions about how to care for your pet
describe other household duties
Write at least 150 words. You do NOT need to write any addresses.
text: It is my pleasure to have a friend like you who can be helpful in needs and I would like to thank you from bottom of my heart for agreeing to take care of my pet and house in my absence. My neighbor Smitha aunty can be a best contact in case of any urgency and you can also reach out to me via phone if in case of any concerns or questions.

As you already know Jumbo is very friendly natured and in fact he likes your company too.Just make sure he gets his food on time or else you might see him going crazy with hungry and please take some time in a day for a quick walk with him, most probably evening will be ideal as you will be back from the school.

Now coming to the household things, please make sure you take the trash out from the house in the night and place it in front of the door before everyday 6:00Pm ,so that the community helpers can take it other wise you might need to drive to trash collector on the end of the street to throw it.
Once again thank you so much for the help and please feel free to reach me out on my phone if any questions or doubts.

error_list.error_des: The spelling of neighbor is a non-British variant. For consistency, consider replacing it with the British English spelling.
It appears that the phrase a best contact does not contain the correct article usage. Consider making a change.
It appears that you are missing a comma after the introductory phrase in fact. Consider adding a comma.
It seems that there is an article usage problem here.
The word everyday may be used incorrectly. Review the following notes to determine the appropriate usage for your context.
It appears that you have an unnecessary comma before the dependent clause marker so that. Consider removing the comma.
The word other wise seems to be miswritten. Consider replacing it.
